intro: Chelone atropurpurea, commonly known as black hellebore, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It features striking, heart-shaped leaves that are dark green with a purple underside. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Chelone atropurpurea is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
